content.description: Sit start on the left side of the boulder. Using the horn, make a powerful move into the crack until you can establish your feet in it. At this point tend leftward, and climb the center of the belly.
content.protection: A few pads and a good spotter.
content.location: Located on the East face of the Underbelly Boulder.

content.description:
Stand or Jump start to large right hand jug and large left hand side pull. Traverse up the arête to the right until you get to a "dish" jug about two thirds up the right face of the arête for an exciting top out.  

  This is the 2nd half of the boulder problem "Old Boy"
content.protection: One pad and a spotter to move it.
content.location: Far right side of the Underbelly boulder.

climbs.name: Old Boy (I'm too old for this s *t)

content.description: Sit or squat start with hands on large side pull on the right side of the seam/crack. Move up and to the right following the arete until you reach a large "dish" hold about two thirds the way up the right side of the boulder.
content.protection: At least One pad and a spotter to move the pad.
content.location: Right Side of the Underbelly boulder

content.description: With your feet on the ground, stand start in the thin finger crack. Traverse the crack until you can establish your feet in it. At this point tend leftward, and climb the center of the belly. This route eliminates the first hard move of Sandbagadocious, making it a great way to experience the exciting moves on the belly.
content.protection: A few pads and a good spotter.
content.location: Located on the East face of the Underbelly Boulder.

content.description: This climb follows the obvious line created by the sinuous finger crack. Sit start on the left side of the boulder. Using the horn, make a powerful move into the crack and traverse right and then up the low angle rock.
content.location: Located on the East face of the Underbelly Boulder.

content.description: This route climbs the small detached triangular block located just North of the Underbelly Boulder. Sit start on the right side, and work your way up the two aretes.
content.location: This problem is located on the North side of the Underbelly Boulder.

content.description: Now that it has been cleaned, the East face of this boulder distinctly resembles an enormous belly. This bulbous boulder is further characterized by a sinuous crack system that starts on the lower left and moves towards the center of the boulder.
